Package edu.bowdoin.csci.TicketManager.model.ticket

Class Ticket

java.lang.Object
edu.bowdoin.csci.TicketManager.model.ticket.Ticket
public class Ticket extends Object
Ticket object represents a single filed ticket containing information about a specific issue/request.
Author:
Zeb Becker, Michael Martinez

  • Constructor Details

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(int id, String state, String ticketType, String subject, String caller, String category, String priority, String owner, String code, ArrayList<String> notes)
      Constructor for existing tickets being read from file This constructor is intended to create a Ticket when reading input from a ticket file (as per UC1). Additionally, the Ticket.counter should be updated with Ticket.setCounter(id + 1) IF, the incoming id is greater than the current value in Ticket.counter.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique integer ID for this ticket.
      state - : String representing current state of this ticket.
      ticketType - : String representing type of this ticket.
      subject - : String representing subject of this ticket.
      caller - : String identifying caller who originated the ticket.
      category - : String identifying category of this ticket.
      priority - : String determining what priority level this ticket has.
      owner - : String representing owner responsible for this ticket.
      code - : String determining what code this ticket has.
      notes - : ArrayList of Strings with each note attached to this ticket.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the rules in UC1 are broken.

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(Ticket.TicketType type, String subject, String caller, Ticket.Category category, Ticket.Priority priority, String note)
      Constructor for new ticket Constructs a Ticket from the provided parameters. The ticketId is set to the value stored in Ticket.counter. The counter is then incremented using Ticket.incrementCounter(). The rest of the fields are initialized to the parameter values, null, false, or an empty object type as appropriate. The owner field should be initialized to an empty string (e.g., "").
      Parameters:
      type - Type of ticket.
      subject - String noting subject of this ticket.
      caller - String identifying caller who originated the ticket.
      category - Category identifying what category of issue this ticket relates to.
      priority - Priority of ticket as Priority.
      note - String first note for this ticket.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if any of the parameters are null or empty strings (if a String type), or if ticket rules are broken.

  • Method Details

    • incrementCounter

      public static void incrementCounter()
      Increase counter

    • setCounter

      public static void setCounter(int num)
      Set counter element of Ticket to number.
      Parameters:
      num - number to set counter to. Must be > 0.
      Throws:
      IAE - if num is not a valid integer > 0.

      public String getFeedbackCode()
      Get feedback code, if one exists. String representation.
      Returns:
      feedbackCode

    • getNotes

      public String getNotes()
      Get set of notes for this ticket, represented as a string. Each individual note occurs on its own line, preceded by a '-' character and with one newline character following.
      Returns:
      notes as string

    • getOwner

      public String getOwner()
      Get String identifying owner who is responsible for this ticket.
      Returns:
      ownerId

    • getPriority

      public String getPriority()
      Get priority of ticket, represented as string.
      Returns:
      priority

    • getResolutionCode

      public String getResolutionCode()
      Get resolution code, represented as String, if one exists and the ticket is in a state that can have an active resolution code.
      Returns:
      resolutionCode

    • getState

      public String getState()
      Get current state of this ticket, represented as string.
      Returns:
      state as string

    • getSubject

      public String getSubject()
      Get subject of this ticket.
      Returns:
      ticketSubject

    • getTicketId

      public int getTicketId()
      Get id of this ticket.

      Returns:

    • getTicketTypeString

      public String getTicketTypeString()
      Get ticket type represented as a string.
      Returns:
      ticketType
      Throws:
      IAE - if ticket does not have a valid ticket type.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      String representation of this Ticket. Each field of the ticket is printed on its own line, with a label. Then the notes are printed with each one on each line, using Ticket.getNotes() method.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string representation of this ticket object

    • update

      public void update(Command c)
      Updates the state of the ticket given a Command object. Delegates actual transition to concrete State the ticket is currently in, implementing the Finite State Machine pattern.
      Parameters:
      c - command instructing ticket what action to take.
